channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Mark Meadows, Donald Trump’s former White House chief of staff, was told Jan. 6 could turn violent but pushed ahead with plans for a rally, a House panel said. https://t.co/5nGSKsGBj9

Japan and New Zealand opened talks on an agreement for “seamless” sharing of classified information, a step that could strengthen Tokyo’s case to eventually join the “Five Eyes” intelligence partnership among English-speaking powers. https://t.co/6mc7ORuV4I

The wider ambitions a Russian general expressed on Friday — to take southern Ukraine all the way to Moldova, Ukraine’s southwest neighbor — reveal larger truths about Moscow’s agenda, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine said. https://t.co/dMtXcj0pze

Florida rejected dozens of math textbooks last week. Using online sample materials provided by publishers to Florida school districts, The New York Times reviewed 21 of them to figure out why. https://t.co/WtgqF0LDHK
Hackers claim to have broken into dozens of Russian institutions over the past two months, including one of the Kremlin’s intelligence services. https://t.co/rfaFoOIVMr

In a promo for a Tucker Carlson show on Fox News, a naked man atop a rock pile exposes his genitals to red light from what appears to be an air purifier, described as a treatment for a testosterone “calamity.” An endocrinologist says it's all ridiculous. https://t.co/mgy8jcpb58

Rep. Kevin McCarthy’s false claim that he never urged Donald Trump to resign after the Capitol riot exposed the hypocrisy of Republicans who have privately scorned Trump while publicly defending him, a phenomenon widely known but seldom seen in Washington. https://t.co/ECO7XJSYGW

Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene on Friday repeated false claims of fraud in the 2020 election as she defended her actions surrounding the Capitol riot, in an extraordinary hearing on whether she should be labeled an “insurrectionist” and barred from office. https://t.co/WQ2D9fHuUh

The Tennessee General Assembly became what is believed to be the first state legislature to pass a bill that would require drunken drivers to pay child support if they kill the parent of a minor.
The bill will now go to the governor for his signature. https://t.co/75keU4IONb

A series of satellite images show what appears to be a growing mass grave site on the outskirts of Mariupol. The holes were dug between March and April, while Russian forces were in control of the Ukrainian town, according to a New York Times analysis. https://t.co/IYUa6UUf0D https://t.co/znMTSKhozN

The UN detailed a “horror story” of possible war crimes and abuses unfolding in Ukraine, citing indiscriminate shelling, hundreds of summary executions and the widespread devastation of civilian lives. https://t.co/gsZRtcI5Sj

Donald Trump Jr. has agreed to voluntarily meet with the House committee investigating the Jan. 6 Capitol attack. Texts show he encouraged White House officials to pursue “multiple paths” to overturn his father’s loss in the days after the election. https://t.co/fmLMrcjhZm

Thirteen female athletes who were sexually assaulted by Larry Nassar are seeking $10 million each from the FBI, alleging that agents mishandled an investigation and allowed the former sports doctor to continue abusing more victims. https://t.co/hOuFTEz64q

Marine Le Pen, the far-right challenger for the French presidency, is linked to President Vladimir Putin of Russia by a web of financial ties and a history of support that has hardly dimmed despite the war in Ukraine. https://t.co/HDHGnSbAjD

President Biden announced another $800 million in military aid to Ukraine on Thursday, saying it sent an “unmistakable message” to Russia’s president, Vladimir Putin: “He will never succeed in dominating and occupying all of Ukraine.” https://t.co/cfB0Cx5PYu https://t.co/hosUtWksgv

In a one-year study, people who confined a low-calorie diet to certain hours lost no more weight than those who ate at any time.
"There is no benefit to eating in a narrow window," one diet researcher said. https://t.co/SAAQ6H9Kkf
Kevin McCarthy denied saying that he would urge Donald Trump to resign after Jan. 6, but a short audio clip tells a different story. https://t.co/VkCyEPN38j

Florida lawmakers voted to revoke Disney World’s special tax status, a move seen as retaliation after Disney, Florida’s largest private employer, criticized the “Don’t Say Gay” law. Gov. Ron DeSantis will almost certainly sign the measure. https://t.co/3XvCb20f7m https://t.co/fVHfWv5EJq

Breaking News: Florida lawmakers voted to revoke Disney World’s special tax status, a step seen as retaliation for Disney’s criticism of the “Don’t Say Gay” law. The move revokes a privilege that effectively allowed Disney to self-govern its theme park. https://t.co/bQ4LsCYquA
Breaking News: Warner Bros. Discovery is shutting down CNN+. The streaming service debuted just weeks ago and was meant to bring CNN into the digital future. https://t.co/vqApzdFQvY

Two men took money from donors to a project meant to help Donald Trump's border wall and spent it on jewelry, plastic surgery and a golf cart, prosecutors say. They are expected to plead guilty in Federal District Court in Manhattan, court filings show. https://t.co/3HjdDlbMQE
Kevin McCarthy vowed to push Donald Trump to resign after Jan. 6, and Mitch McConnell said he deserved impeachment. Then their fury faded. https://t.co/IdcrdpypFa

Pedro Sánchez and Mette Frederiksen, the prime ministers of Spain and Denmark, arrived in Kyiv to meet with President Volodymyr Zelensky. They are the latest in a series of European leaders to visit the Ukrainian capital.
Follow our updates on Ukraine. https://t.co/yJZTNCWch1 https://t.co/kp5zcO6nJF

People have been finding hungry, scared kangaroos in forests in eastern India.
They were almost certainly smuggled into India to be exotic pets, wildlife experts say. Some view the sightings as an example of how brazen the smuggling trade has become. https://t.co/dgfx4apYZm https://t.co/4vuJuNbKtr

The actor Johnny Depp took the stand for the second day on Wednesday to describe his turbulent marriage to the actress Amber Heard, whom he has sued for defamation, accusing her of “demeaning name-calling” that often escalated into physical violence. https://t.co/zFt6F05QZI

European intelligence agencies have warned about Russian spies for years. Now, an investigation in Slovakia exposed how their secret operations are trying to cause conflict in Europe and create sympathy for Moscow's war in Ukraine. https://t.co/s919IHgEs0

A majority of people in the U.S. favored requiring people on planes, trains and buses to wear masks, according to a new poll that was conducted in all 50 states right before a federal judge struck down the mask mandate on planes and public transit. https://t.co/1Bb1exVIgA

Donald Trump’s campaign was ordered to pay nearly $1.3 million in legal fees to Omarosa Manigault Newman, the former White House aide and “Apprentice” star, after he unsuccessfully sued her for writing a tell-all book. https://t.co/4TrlukAdOs

Trevor Jacob, a YouTuber who posted a video of himself parachuting out of a plane that he claimed had malfunctioned, had his private pilot certificate revoked. The FAA found that he purposely abandoned the aircraft. https://t.co/KGrmiGgbfP

Public health experts expressed dismay over a U.S. judge’s ruling that struck down the public transit mask mandate.
“If this ruling stands, it could put the American public at great risk,” said Dr. Richard Besser, a former acting director of the CDC. https://t.co/eIWKZ8Zh0a

The Ukrainian postal service printed a run of one million stamps with the image of a Ukrainian special forces fighter raising his middle finger at a Russian warship. The stamps have sold out. https://t.co/SEIimTrOlb
Breaking News: The Justice Department will appeal a court ruling striking down the federal mask mandate on public transportation, at the CDC’s request. https://t.co/ZRYXkRG7p5

In Opinion
Marine Le Pen "may pretend to be a regular politician, but she remains as dangerous as ever," says Rim-Sarah Alouane, who writes about French politics, in a guest essay. "For the good of minorities and France itself, she must not prevail." https://t.co/FeijmQrLbD

Russian and Belarusian athletes will be barred from playing at Wimbledon because of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and Belarus’ support of the war. The decision would exclude a number of highly ranked players, including No. 2 Daniil Medvedev. https://t.co/PqYXUexJcz
Watch how some airline passengers reacted to the TSA abruptly stopping the enforcement of its mask mandate on planes and in airports on Tuesday. https://t.co/6PE6QWwDHZ https://t.co/XwaeTAJz4J

Gov. Ron DeSantis asked Florida lawmakers on Tuesday to consider the “termination” of self-governing privileges that Disney World has held in the Orlando area for 55 years after Disney condemned a new state education law known as “Don’t Say Gay.” https://t.co/MmgW3diSKL

In Opinion
"We admire him because, in the face of unequal odds, Ukraine’s president stands his ground. Because he proves the truth of the adage that one man with courage makes a majority," Bret Stephens writes of President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine. https://t.co/UAH4uiqqqg

Automated payment and the spread of tipping to every corner of the food-service business have helped workers weather the pandemic. But some diners feel that tipping has gotten excessive.
Join the conversation: https://t.co/DG0oiHoxhT https://t.co/fhXQMkm9Z9

Wimbledon officials were set to announce they would bar Russian and Belarusian players from playing in this year's tournament because of Russia’s invasion of Ukraine and Belarus’ support of the war. https://t.co/kLL4S7xaTo

After a ruling on Monday that struck down a federal mask mandate on planes and public transportation, our reporters want to hear from you: Will you keep masking? Are you changing your travel plans? https://t.co/SI4fOuWzdW https://t.co/S77U1PLNLk

New York Times cameras captured life on the front lines in southeast Ukraine, where Russian shelling is relentless and it feels like the war is inching closer every day. https://t.co/2OMZOL629a https://t.co/zTsvZmiYS4
Breaking News: The Diocese of Camden, N.J., agreed to pay $87.5 million in one of the largest sex abuse settlements involving the Catholic Church in the U.S. https://t.co/LVsvDGJK1b

Breaking News: President Biden said it’s up to individuals whether to wear masks, undercutting efforts by his administration to urge Americans to keep wearing them on airplanes and public transit after a federal judge struck down a nationwide mask mandate. https://t.co/2b2Kcs9o5h

It can be confusing to figure out where you should still wear a mask if you want to protect yourself and those around you. Here’s a guide to the places and situations where experts say it’s still a good idea to cover your face. https://t.co/zHTcIXZsBg https://t.co/5dCZYxcpFG

Greek authorities have seized a Russian-owned oil tanker in the Aegean Sea. The seizure did not relate to the cargo of crude oil but to the ship itself, which belongs to a Russian bank on the EU sanctions list, a spokesman for the Greek coast guard said. https://t.co/91NrF2fzBV

Many U.S. airlines dropped their mask requirements on Monday after a judge struck down the federal mandate for airplanes and public transit. But experts say it’s a good idea to wear a mask, especially on planes. https://t.co/bp7Le4fZTj

Many U.S. airlines dropped their mask requirements on Monday after a judge struck down the federal mandate for airplanes and public transit. But experts say it’s a good idea to wear a mask, especially on planes. https://t.co/8zltuQn4vR
How safe are you from Covid-19 when you get on a plane? Our air flow simulation can explain.https://t.co/VJJfnWHn1A

Drone crews have killed more people than nearly anyone else in the military in the past decade, but they seldom got the same recovery periods or mental-health screenings as other fighters.
The unseen scars of those who kill via remote control: https://t.co/pGMXpudWlK

Breaking News: The Biden administration reversed a Trump-era change to an environmental law, again requiring agencies to weigh climate impacts before they approve highways, pipelines and other major projects. https://t.co/f0cBcEEdrt
